note: 数据采集车辆配备了顶部和七个摄像机的一个40梁激光雷达。
note_en: The data acquisition vehicle is equipped with one 40-beam LiDAR on the top and seven cameras.
title: 一旦数据集：自动驾驶的一百万场景
title_en: Once Dataset: One Million Scenes for Autonomous Driving

note:
华盛顿 - 最高法院于周一裁定，超过200个审理专利纠纷的行政法官，其中一些人超过数十亿美元，违反了宪法。
 该解决方案是一项突破大多数法院裁定的，是向美国专利和商标办公室的董事审查法官决定的权力，以便在2011年的法律下提出，使其更容易挑战可疑专利。
 该程序的支持者称为“缔约方之间的”拉丁语“审查，这些审查是”各方之间“的”，“这有助于打击专利”巨魔“，或获得专利，而不是使用他们的专利，而是为了要求赔偿金额和起诉。对手表示，该过程倾向于取消有效专利。
 星期一的决定意味着挑战将在很大程度上按之前进行，而不会改变法官如何被任命。法院的缩小修复，使法官对额外监督进行额外的监督，缺乏上台当前制度。
 案件，美国诉Arthrex，19-1434号，从史密斯＆amp提起的挑战中出现;侄子，医疗技术公司，反对竞争对手举办的专利，Arthrex在医疗设备上。关于专利审判和上诉委员会的法官小组，该委员会在2011年法律规定的行政部门的行政法庭，裁定Arthrex的专利无效。
 Arthrex向美国呼吁联邦赛道上诉，华盛顿专门法院呼吁，称，应当抛弃专利法官的决定，因为他们没有被妥善任命。
 上诉法院同意，裁定法官在没有监督的情况下在没有监督的情况下进行了重要工作，因此“主要官员”是“宪法”，这意味着他们必须由总统委任并由参议院委任。 
上诉法院对宪法问题的解决方案是将一部分裁减保护专利法官免于未经原因。上诉法院表示，这有效地将其从“主要官员”中解雇。
 首席大法官John G. Roberts Jr.周一为五位司法人士写作，同意宪法问题有一个符合法官如何被任命及其职责之间的宪法问题。他写的“令人难以置信的行政权力行使”，他写道，“与他们的地位不相容。”
 “只有一名官员恰当被任命为主要办事处，可能会在我们面前的诉讼中发出最终决定，”首席司法写道。
 正义塞缪尔A. Alito Jr.，Neil M. Gorsuch，Brett M. Kavanaugh和Amy Coney Barrett加入了首席大法官的意见。
 首席大法官罗伯茨只在他看来的另一部分中只写了四个法官，这是法院应该如何了解它所确定的宪法问题。他表示，法官的决定必须受到董事的审查。正义戈斯鲁奇与裁决的一部分不同意，称由国会提出如何解决如何解决宪法缺陷。
 Justice Stephen G. Breyer，Justices Sonia Sotomayor和Elena Kagan加入，从首席司法的意见的第一部分失差。 “今天的决定”，“他写道，”既是前所未有的，不必要的，而且风险将司法机构进一步推动到我们缺乏行动和明智行动的能力和行动能力的领域。“
 但是，这三个法官仍然表示，他们接受了罗伯茨的首席大法官的解决方案对大多数人发现的问题。 
Quadice Clarence Thomas发出了一个独立的异议，由Breyer，Sotomayor和Kagan大法内加入大部分。 “法院今天绘制了一条新的线路从主体上划分了校长的官员，”他写道。 “这条线在大使的行政专利法官在大使，最高法院法官和部门的主题表明某些事情并不完全正确。”
note_en:
WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court  ruled on Monday that more than 200 administrative judges who hear patent disputes, some of them over billions of dollars, had been appointed in violation of the Constitution.
 The solution, a fractured majority of the court ruled, was to give the director of the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office the power to review the judges’ decisions in cases brought under a 2011  law that made it easier to challenge questionable patents.
 Supporters of the procedure, called inter partes review, which is Latin for “between the parties,” say it  helps combat patent “trolls,” or companies that obtain patents not to use them but to demand royalties and sue for damages. Opponents say the procedure is skewed toward the cancellation of valid patents.
 The decision on Monday means the challenges will largely proceed as before, without changes to how the judges are appointed. The court’s narrow fix, subjecting the judges to additional supervision, fell well short of upending the current system.
 The case, United States v. Arthrex, No. 19-1434, arose from a challenge filed by Smith & Nephew, a medical technology company, against patents held by a competitor, Arthrex, on a medical device. A panel of judges on the Patent Trial and Appeal Board, an administrative tribunal in the executive branch created by the 2011 law, ruled that Arthrex’s patents were invalid.
 Arthrex appealed to the United States Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit, a specialized court in Washington, saying that the patent judges’ decision should be thrown out because they had not been properly appointed.
 The appeals court agreed, ruling that the judges performed important work without supervision and so were “principal officers” under the Constitution, meaning that they had to be appointed by the president and confirmed by the Senate.
 The appeals court’s solution to the constitutional problem was to strike down a part of the law that protected the patent judges from being fired without cause. This effectively demoted them from “principal officers,” the appeals court said.
 Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr., writing for five justices on Monday, agreed that there was a constitutional problem with the fit between how the judges had been appointed and their duties. “The unreviewable executive power exercised” by the judges, he wrote, “is incompatible with their status as inferior officers.”
 “Only an officer properly appointed to a principal office may issue a final decision binding the executive branch in the proceeding before us,” the chief justice wrote.
 Justices Samuel A. Alito Jr., Neil M. Gorsuch, Brett M. Kavanaugh and Amy Coney Barrett joined that part of the chief justice’s opinion.
 Chief Justice Roberts wrote for only four justices in another part of his opinion, this one concerning what the court should do about the constitutional problem it had identified. He said the judges’ decisions must be made subject to the director’s review. Justice Gorsuch did not agree with that part of the ruling, saying it was up to Congress to address how to fix the constitutional flaw.
 Justice Stephen G. Breyer, joined by Justices Sonia Sotomayor and Elena Kagan, dissented from the first part of the chief justice’s opinion. “Today’s decision,” he wrote, “is both unprecedented and unnecessary, and risks pushing the judiciary further into areas where we lack both the authority to act and the capacity to act wisely.”
 But those three justices nonetheless said they accepted Chief Justice Roberts’s solution to the problem the majority had identified.
 Justice Clarence Thomas issued a separate dissent, joined in large part by Justices Breyer, Sotomayor and Kagan. “The court today draws a new line dividing inferior officers from principal ones,” he wrote. “The fact that this line places administrative patent judges on the side of ambassadors, Supreme Court justices and department heads suggests that something is not quite right.”
title: 最高法院表示，超过200名专利法官被委任不当被委任
title_en: Over 200 Patent Judges Were Improperly Appointed, Supreme Court Says

note:
α-GAL综合征是最近确定的红肉和其他由哺乳动物制成的产品的食物过敏。在美国，当一个孤独的星际蜱咬某人时，最常常开始的情况。咬合将称为α-gal的糖分子传递到人体中。在某些人中，这触发了一种免疫系统反应，后来产生了对红肉的严重过敏反应，例如牛肉，猪肉或羊肉或其他哺乳动物产品。
  Lone Star Tick主要在美国东南部发现，大多数alpha-gal综合征的病例发生在该地区。蜱也可以在美国东部和南部的美国中部发现。然而，这种情况似乎散布了南北，然而，随着鹿携带孤独的星蜱到美国的新部分。 Alpha-Gal综合征也被诊断为欧洲，澳大利亚和亚洲，其中其他类型的蜱圈携带α-Gal分子。
 研究人员现在相信一些常见的人，不明显的过敏反应的人 - 以及为其他食物过敏测试阴性 - 可能受到α-GAL综合征的影响。除了避免哺乳动物制成的红肉和其他产品之外，没有治疗。
 避免刻度叮咬是预防的关键。通过穿着长裤和长袖衬衫和使用昆虫，草地，草地区的昆虫障碍物来防止蜱叮咬。在外面花时间进行彻底，全身刻度检查。
      与其他食物过敏相比，α-GAL过敏反应的迹象和症状通常会延迟。例如，对常见食品过敏原或贝类的最反应 - 例如 - 发生在曝光的几分钟内。在α-加仑综合征中，反应通常在暴露后出现约3至6小时。红肉，如牛肉，猪肉或羊肉;器官肉;和由哺乳动物制成的产品，例如明胶或乳制品，可导致反应。
   医生认为吃红肉和开发过敏反应的时间延迟是病症被忽视的一个原因。在午夜的晚餐和荨麻疹的T骨牛排之间可能的连接远远明显。
   如果您在进食后发现食物过敏症状，请参阅初级保健医生或专门诊断和治疗过敏（过敏症）的医生 - 甚至在进食后几个小时。不要排除红肉作为你反应的可能原因，特别是如果你在美国东南部或在世界其他地区住在户外，那么众所周知，就会发生α-加仑综合征的世界其他地区。 
大多数开发美国在美国开发alpha-gal综合征的人开发了一个孤独的星蜱咬它们的条件。来自其他类型的蜱虫的叮咬可能导致欧洲，澳大利亚和亚洲的状况。
   据信导致α-GAL综合征的蜱虫，从动物的血液中携带α-Gal分子，它们通常咬住，例如奶牛和羊。当载体蜱咬住人时，蜱将alpha-gal注入人的身体。
 出于未知的原因，有些人对这些分子具有如此强烈的免疫应答，即它们不能再吃哺乳动物制成的红肉或产品而没有轻度至严重的过敏反应。随着时间的推移，接触到许多蜱叮咬的人可能会产生更严重的症状。
   与α-GAL综合征有关的抗体的人可以对癌症药物辛酸（Erbitux）具有过敏反应。西妥昔单抗诱导这种情况的病例在具有高孤星蜱虫蜱的地区中最常见的，这表明孤星蜱叮咬和对α-GAL综合征的增加的脆弱性之间可能的联系。需要更多的研究来了解在某些地区携带alpha-gal的蜱之间的联系，并且alpha-gal综合征似乎直接链接到滴点叮咬。
 研究人员认为，α-GAL综合征的标志时间延迟反应是由于α-GAL分子比其他过敏原在待消化并进入循环系统的情况下。
   医生不知道为什么有些人在曝光后和其他人开发alpha-gal综合征，其他人在＆＃39; t。这种情况主要发生在美国东南部，纽约，新泽西州和新英格兰的地区。如果您在这些地区生活或花时间，您＆＃39;在这些地区生活或花时间增加风险
  在过去的20到30年里，孤岛蜱已经发现大量的北部是缅因州，而在美国德克萨斯州中部和俄克拉荷马州。 
Alpha-Gal综合征也可能发生在世界其他地区，如欧洲，澳大利亚和亚洲的部分地区，其中某些类型的蜱虫叮咬也似乎增加了风险的风险。
   α-GAL综合征可导致食物诱导的过敏反应，一种需要用肾上腺素（肾上腺素）注射器（Epipen，Auvi-Q，其他）治疗和访问急诊室的医疗紧急情况。
   基于最近的研究，医生现在认为有些人常见的是过敏性的，可能与未结识的α-GAL综合征生活。
   预防alpha-gal综合征的最佳方法是避免蜱虫，特别是树木，浓密的浓密区域，带有长草的地区。您可以减少带有一些简单预防措施的Alpha-Gal综合征的风险：
 掩饰。当在树木繁茂的或草地上，穿鞋，长裤塞进袜子里，一件长袖衬衫，帽子和手套。尽量坚持小径，避免走过低灌木丛和长草。把你的狗放在皮带上。
  使用驱虫剂。用20％或更高浓度的DEET涂抹昆虫驱蚊剂到您的皮肤上。父母应该向他们的孩子申请驱除者，避免他们的手，眼睛和嘴巴。请记住，化学驱动剂可能有毒，因此仔细遵循方向。用Permethrin涂抹产品或购买预处理的衣服。
  尽力勾选你的院子。清晰的刷子和叶子在哪里活着。让木材保持在阳光明媚的地区。 
检查自己，您的孩子和您的宠物蜱。在树木繁茂的或草地上花时间特别警惕。
  它＆＃39;在室内来，尽快淋浴。在附加本身之前，蜱经常留在你的皮肤上。淋浴和使用毛巾可能会删除未连接的蜱虫。
  用镊子尽快删除勾号。轻轻抓住头部或嘴巴附近的蜱虫。不要挤压或挤压蜱，但仔细和稳定地拉动。一旦你＆＃39; ve删除了整个蜱虫，处理它并将防腐剂应用于咬合区域。
 ＆＃34;他们在一个位置。他们会爬上最近的物体，就像这片草叶一样。＆＃34;它＆＃39; s被称为任务。 ＆＃34;它伸出腿，这允许它抓住他们走路的主持人。＆＃34;你可以减少你的机会＆＃39; ll成为一个主人。 ＆＃34;使用驱虫剂是一个好主意。＆＃34;
 梅奥诊所寄生虫疾病专家Bobbi Pritt博士为您的衣服和装备表达了Permethrin。
  ＆＃34;你真的可以让你的装备饱和。把它们留出来干燥，然后，第二天，穿上它们。＆＃34;
  在皮肤上使用Permethrin和Deet。在暴露的皮肤上喷洒Deet驱蚊剂，包括你的腿和手。避免你的脸，但一定要保护你的脖子。然后，把你的裤子塞进你的袜子里。而且，在您的徒步旅行中，记得避免可能栖息蜱虫的地区。 
＆＃34;那个＆＃39;为什么要远离高大的草地。 留在中间。＆＃34;  Steinke Jw等人。 Alpha-Gal Story：从连接点的经验教训。 过敏与临床免疫学杂志。 2015; 135：589。  Platts-mills ta，等。 50年后的IgE发现。 过敏，哮喘＆amp史册; 免疫学。 2016; 116：179。  Platts-mills ta，等。 IgE在过敏性疾病的诊断和治疗中。 过敏与临床免疫学杂志。 2016; 137：1662。  卡特MC等人。 鉴定特发性过敏性的患者α-GAL敏感性。 过敏。 2017年; DOI：10.1111 /全部13366。  孤星蜱一个问题，但不是莱姆病。 疾病预防与控制中心。 https://www.cdc.gov/stari/disease/index.html。 进入2018年4月13日。  Berg Ea，等 药物过敏原和食物 - 西妥昔单抗和半乳糖-α-1,3-半乳糖故事。 过敏，哮喘＆amp史册; 免疫学。 2014; 112：97。 
alpha-gal和红肉过敏。 美国过敏院，哮喘＆amp; 免疫学。 https://www.aaaai.org/conditions-and-treatments/library/allergy-library/alpha-gal。 访问了2020年6月2日。
note_en:
Alpha-gal syndrome is a recently identified type of food allergy to red meat and other products made from mammals. In the United States, the condition most often begins when a Lone Star tick bites someone. The bite transmits a sugar molecule called alpha-gal into the person's body. In some people, this triggers an immune system reaction that later produces mild to severe allergic reactions to red meat, such as beef, pork or lamb, or other mammal products.
  The Lone Star tick is found predominantly in the southeastern United States, and most cases of alpha-gal syndrome occur in this region. The tick can also be found in the eastern and south central United States. The condition appears to be spreading farther north and west, however, as deer carry the Lone Star tick to new parts of the United States. Alpha-gal syndrome also has been diagnosed in Europe, Australia and Asia, where other types of ticks carry alpha-gal molecules.
 Researchers now believe that some people who have frequent, unexplained anaphylactic reactions — and who test negative for other food allergies — may be affected by alpha-gal syndrome. There's no treatment other than avoiding red meat and other products made from mammals.
 Avoiding tick bites is the key to prevention. Protect against tick bites by wearing long pants and long-sleeved shirts and using insect repellents when you're in wooded, grassy areas. Do a thorough, full-body tick check after spending time outside.
      Signs and symptoms of an alpha-gal allergic reaction are often delayed compared with other food allergies. Most reactions to common food allergens — peanuts or shellfish, for example — happen within minutes of exposure. In alpha-gal syndrome, reactions usually appear about three to six hours after exposure. Red meat, such as beef, pork or lamb; organ meats; and products made from mammals, such as gelatins or dairy products, can cause a reaction.
   Doctors think the time delay between eating red meat and developing an allergic reaction is one reason the condition was overlooked until recently. A possible connection between a T-bone steak with dinner and hives at midnight was far from obvious.
   See your primary care doctor or a doctor who specializes in the diagnosis and treatment of allergies (allergist) if you experience food allergy symptoms after eating — even several hours after eating. Don't rule out red meat as a possible cause of your reaction, especially if you live or spend time outdoors in the southeastern United States or in other parts of the world where alpha-gal syndrome is known to occur.
       Most people who develop alpha-gal syndrome in the U.S. develop the condition when a Lone Star tick bites them. Bites from other types of ticks can lead to the condition in Europe, Australia and Asia.
   Ticks that cause alpha-gal syndrome are believed to carry alpha-gal molecules from the blood of the animals they commonly bite, such as cows and sheep. When a carrier tick bites a human, the tick injects alpha-gal into the person's body.
 For unknown reasons, some people have such a strong immune response to these molecules that they can no longer eat red meat or products made from mammals without a mild to severe allergic reaction. People who are exposed to many tick bites over time may develop more-severe symptoms.
   People with antibodies related to alpha-gal syndrome can have allergic reactions to the cancer drug cetuximab (Erbitux). Cetuximab-induced cases of this condition are most common in regions with a high population of Lone Star ticks, suggesting a possible link between Lone Star tick bites and an increased vulnerability to alpha-gal syndrome. More research is needed to understand the connection between ticks that carry alpha-gal in certain regions and cases of alpha-gal syndrome that don't seem directly linked to tick bites.
 Researchers think the hallmark time-delayed reaction of alpha-gal syndrome is due to the alpha-gal molecules taking longer than other allergens to be digested and enter your circulatory system.
   Doctors don't yet know why some people develop alpha-gal syndrome after exposure and others don't. The condition mostly occurs in the southeastern United States and parts of New York, New Jersey and New England. You're at increased risk if you live or spend time in these regions and:
  In the past 20 to 30 years, the Lone Star tick has been found in large numbers as far north as Maine and as far west as central Texas and Oklahoma in the United States.
 Alpha-gal syndrome can also occur in other parts of the world such as Europe, Australia and parts of Asia, where bites from certain types of ticks also appear to increase your risk of the condition.
   Alpha-gal syndrome can cause food-induced anaphylaxis, a medical emergency that requires treatment with an epinephrine (adrenaline) injector (EpiPen, Auvi-Q, others) and a visit to the emergency room.
   Based on recent research, doctors now believe that some people with unexplained, frequent anaphylaxis may be living with undiagnosed alpha-gal syndrome.
   The best way to prevent alpha-gal syndrome is to avoid areas where ticks live, especially wooded, bushy areas with long grass. You can decrease your risk of getting alpha-gal syndrome with some simple precautions:
 Cover up. When in wooded or grassy areas, wear shoes, long pants tucked into your socks, a long-sleeved shirt, a hat and gloves. Try to stick to trails and avoid walking through low bushes and long grass. Keep your dog on a leash.
  Use insect repellents. Apply insect repellent with a 20% or higher concentration of DEET to your skin. Parents should apply repellent to their children, avoiding their hands, eyes and mouths. Keep in mind that chemical repellents can be toxic, so follow directions carefully. Apply products with permethrin to clothing or buy pre-treated clothing.
  Do your best to tick-proof your yard. Clear brush and leaves where ticks live. Keep woodpiles in sunny areas.
  Check yourself, your children and your pets for ticks. Be especially vigilant after spending time in wooded or grassy areas.
  It's helpful to shower as soon as you come indoors. Ticks often remain on your skin for hours before attaching themselves. Showering and using a washcloth might remove unattached ticks.
  Remove a tick as soon as possible with tweezers. Gently grasp the tick near its head or mouth. Don't squeeze or crush the tick, but pull carefully and steadily. Once you've removed the entire tick, dispose of it and apply antiseptic to the bite area.
 "They get themselves in a position. And they will climb up the nearest object, like this blade of grass here." It's called questing. "It sticks out its legs, and that allows it to grab on to hosts as they walk by." You can lessen the chances you'll become a host. "Using insect repellents is a good idea."
 Mayo Clinic parasitic diseases expert Dr. Bobbi Pritt suggests permethrin for your clothing and gear.
  "You can really saturate your gear. Leave them out to dry, and, then, the next day, wear them."
  Use permethrin on materials and DEET on skin. Spray the DEET repellent on exposed skin, including your legs and hands. Avoid your face, but be sure to protect your neck. Then, tuck your pants into your socks. And, on your hike, remember to avoid areas where those questing ticks may be perched.
  "That's why you want to stay away from the tall grasses. Stay in the middle."
               Steinke JW, et al. The alpha-gal story: Lessons learned from connecting the dots. Journal of Allergy and Clinical Immunology. 2015;135:589.
  Platts-Mills TA, et al. The discovery of IgE 50 years later. Annals of Allergy, Asthma & Immunology. 2016;116:179.
  Platts-Mills TA, et al. IgE in the diagnosis and treatment of allergic disease. Journal of Allergy and Clinical Immunology. 2016;137:1662.
        Carter MC, et al. Identification of alpha-gal sensitivity in patients with a diagnosis of idiopathic anaphylaxis. Allergy. 2017; doi:10.1111/all.13366.
  Lone star tick a concern, but not for Lyme disease. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. https://www.cdc.gov/stari/disease/index.html. Accessed April 13, 2018.
    Berg EA, et al. Drug allergens and food—the cetuximab and galactose-α-1,3-galactose story. Annals of Allergy, Asthma & Immunology. 2014;112:97.
        Alpha-gal and red meat allergy. American Academy of Allergy, Asthma & Immunology. https://www.aaaai.org/conditions-and-treatments/library/allergy-library/alpha-gal. Accessed June 2, 2020.
title: alpha-gal综合征

note: 这是一个双赢。 医院需要防止患者死亡败血症，感染并发症; 和史诗般的医疗记录最大的卖方，需要用户的新产品 - 这是一种可以预测哪种患者会培养这种情况的算法，所以医生可以介入前面。  在过去的几年里，数百家医院已经插入了算法，而无需验证其广告的80％的精度率。 然后，密歇根大学的一群研究人员开始对其表现提出问题。  STAT +是统计学和＃39; STAT＆＃39;深入的生物技术，制药，政策和生命科学覆盖和分析。 我们屡获殊荣的队伍涵盖华尔街，华盛顿政策发展，早期科学突破和临床试验结果，以及硅谷及以后的医疗保健中断。  每周机会与我们的记者和领先的行业专家参与实时视频对话
note_en:
It was a win-win. Hospitals needed to prevent patient deaths from sepsis, a complication of infection; and Epic, the nation’s largest seller of medical records, needed users for its new product — an algorithm that could predict which patients would develop the condition so doctors could intervene earlier.
 Over the last few years, hundreds of hospitals have plugged in the algorithm without verifying its advertised 80% accuracy rate. Then a group of researchers at the University of Michigan started asking questions about its performance.
  STAT+ is STAT's premium subscription service for in-depth biotech, pharma, policy, and life science coverage and analysis.						Our award-winning team covers news on Wall Street, policy developments in Washington, early science breakthroughs and clinical trial results, and health care disruption in Silicon Valley and beyond.
    Weekly opportunities to engage with our reporters and leading industry experts in live video conversations
title: 一种受欢迎的算法，用于预测Sepsis Misses大多数情况并发送错误警报
title_en: A popular algorithm to predict sepsis misses most cases and sends false alarms

note:
是的，飞机可以使用通常被称为“autoland”的系统来降落。飞行员可以将自动飞行员编程以自动进行着陆，同时导航监控飞机。然而，当可以使用Autol和系统时存在限制。
 自动着陆可能占商业航班上所有着陆的1％。许多飞行员实际上认为，由于监测自动加兰德和飞行阶段的汽车飞行员的自动飞行员在所有阶段都需要非常高的警惕，因此对飞行器进行手动降落飞机。
 波音737（世界上最成功的客机）仅限于执行自动着陆（第3类/ CAT III方法）时的25公里的最大交叉风（许多航空公司15公吨）。当通常很少或没有风时，自动驾驶仪通常用于降低低可见度条件（如果它非常刮风，雾很少形成）。一旦风拾取，与汽车飞行员相比，平均飞行员在应对条件并降落飞机时远更好。
  自动着陆需要高水平的自动化监控，需要每六个月重新培训专业飞行员。 Autoland只能在严格的条件下进行，要求在飞机上的认证（通常由于技术问题而不是技术问题而降级为无高尔兰特能力），这是飞行员和机场本身。仍然需要飞行器来配置飞机并控制它的速度并监控其飞行路径。任何数量的相对较小的技术问题都可能损害许多失败被动的汽车土地系统，需要进行错过的方法，然后进行可能转移到雾或低云的机场。
 Autoland通常被称为CAT III（3）方法。这是指仪器着陆系统（ILS）的类别，它是一种用于将飞行员指向飞行的最终方法阶段的跑道的无线电援助。并非所有机场都有一个猫III'跑道'，这意味着并非所有机场都可以支持高罗兰业务。同样，Autoland能力不是所有飞机都有的函数。
   猫我需要手动着陆，但跑道可见度必须超过550米，飞行员必须通过海拔200英尺的海拔地区看到跑道。
    CAT III C可能会下降到零可见性，但这实际上不会因为飞机无法从跑道零能见度上出租车而被出租。
note_en:
Yes a plane can land by itself using a system that is often referred to as “autoland”. The pilots can program the auto pilot to carry out the landing automatically whilst the pilots monitor the aircraft. However there are limitations as to when the autoland system can be used.
 Automatic landings probably account for less then 1% of all landings on commercial flights. Many pilots actually think it’s much easier to land the aircraft manually, as monitoring the auto pilot in the autoland stage of flight is itself very demanding with a very high level of vigilance required at all stages.
 The  Boeing 737 (the world’s most successful airliner in terms of the number sold) is limited to a maximum crosswind of 25kts (15kts for many airlines) when carrying out an automatic landing (Category 3 / CAT III approach). The autopilot is usually used to land in low visibility conditions when there are typically little or no winds (fog will seldom form if it’s very windy). As soon as the wind picks up, the average pilot is far better at coping with the conditions and landing the aircraft when compared to the auto pilot.
  Automatic landings require a high level of automation monitoring that needs  retraining every six months for professional pilots. Autolands can only be performed under strict conditions that require the certification of both the aircraft (often downgraded to no autoland capability due to technical issues), both of the pilots and the airport itself. The pilots are still required to configure the aircraft and control it’s speed and monitor its flight path. Any number of relatively minor technical issues can compromise many fail-passive auto land systems, requiring a missed approach to be carried out and then a possible diversion to an airport which is clear of fog or low cloud.
 An Autoland is often referred to as a CAT III (3) approach. This refers to the category of the  Instrument Landing System (ILS), which is a radio aid used to direct the pilots towards the runway on the final approach stages of flight. Not all airports have a CAT III ‘runway’ which means that not all airports can support Autoland operations. Equally, autoland capability is not a function that all aircraft have.
   CAT I requires a manual landing but runway visibility must be more than 550 meters and pilots must be in sight of the runway by an altitude of 200ft.
    CAT III C can potentially go down to zero visibility but this wouldn’t practically be utilised as the aircraft would be unable to taxi off the runway in zero visibility.
title: 乘客飞机可以自己自己吗？
title_en: Can a passenger plane land own its own?
